TopicTitle: I went to the moon for the first time!

Articles.Content:
That is to say, I downloaded the realistic solar system mod and went to our moon and all of a sudden space travel is incredibly difficult. I knew it would be harder than going to the moon in vanilla KSP, but I didn't realize how much harder O_o. The tiny rocket in the beginng is my standard moon rocket in vanila KSP, and that barely got halfway to orbit. I thought I'd get to the moon with a 100-200 ton craft, but the one I ended up with weighted 1000 tons, and I barely made it.

The thought of going anywhere else is daunting O_o

Other mods I used was FAR, deadly reentry and TAC Life Support.
Very impressed maccollo, Real Solar System is definitely KSP's "hard mode"

Very impressed maccollo, Real Solar System is definitely KSP's "hard mode"

Thanks

It might be really hard, in fact I'm not sure I can build a rocket that can send a kerbal any further than Mars and back, but I can't go back to vanilla KSP now. In a way, having to build the mightiest rocket to launch a rather puny payload feels more epic and rewarding. Not to mention Kirbin/Earth feels much more imposing in RSS!
